intro: Epilobium valdiviense, commonly known as the Valdivian willow, is a species of flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in moist, temperate climates, often found in mountainous areas and along stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and its flowers are usually pink or red, arranged in clusters. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as willows and evening primroses. Epilobium valdiviense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
